titleStmt.title: A letter of Sr. Humfrey Linde, to a lady of great worth, much afflicted for Syr Humfreys sake, hearing him ill spoke of, for not answering the Whetstone, and the Spectacles, that were written against his Via tuta And also for that he is greatly taxed for lying and corrupting of many authours. In which letter he doth cleare himselfe.
titleStmt.author: Floyd, John, 1572-1649.

titleStmt.title: A letter of Sr. Humfrey Linde, to a lady of great worth, much afflicted for Syr Humfreys sake, hearing him ill spoke of, for not answering the Whetstone, and the Spectacles, that were written against his Via tuta And also for that he is greatly taxed for lying and corrupting of many authours. In which letter he doth cleare himselfe.
titleStmt.author: Floyd, John, 1572-1649.
Lynde, Humphrey, Sir.

notesStmt.note: A satire on Lynde, written by J. Floyd?--STC.
Place of publication and press from STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
